resources.string:
AnkiDroid helps you to learn whatever you want. You can create your own flashcards and study them or download packages of other users. AnkiDroid helps you to decide when to recapitulate facts; it shows you the flashcards just before you will forget them.

To get a first impression of how things work, we recommend you to start with the tutorial deck which will give you some initial information and try a bit out. Just just click on "Start Reviewing" after having opened it.

Open tutorial deck now?
Deck could not be loaded.\nPlease selected another one

%1$s Flashcards for Android

AnkiDroid can read .anki files produced by the desktop %2$s Anki software.

To help us make AnkiDroid better, please report any bug %3$s here; new feature ideas are very welcome too! Please use the %4$s wiki and say Hi on the %5$s forum.

AnkiDroid is %6$s open source software, so everyone is encouraged to %7$s join the %8$s contributors :-) Non-developers can also help, for instance by updating the wiki and screenshots, %9$s donating to Anki, or blogging about AnkiDroid!

AnkiDroid is released under the %10$s GNU-GPL v3 license and the source code is available %11$s here.
Decks with versions older than 39 are not supported by AnkiDroid; please open the deck with Anki desktop to upgrade it to the latest version.
The deck can\'t be fully upgraded, because it contains LaTeX expressions; please open the deck with Anki desktop to upgrade it to the latest version and regenerate LaTeX.
Er is een nieuwe versie van AnkiDroid beschikbaar op de Android Market.\n\nWilt u deze installeren?
Toon me geen meldingen meer voor deze update

Wees ervan bewust dat alleen maar vraag en antwoord omdraaien in strijd is met het concept van gespreide herhaling. Idealiter maak je nieuwe kaarten voor de omgekeerde leerrichting. U kunt dit eenvoudig doen met Anki Desktop.\ntoch omdraaien?
This resets the learning progress for all cards of this fact (they will look like new cards).\nReally continue?
All cards of this fact reset

An error occured while answering/changing the last card. This could be related to a corrupt deck or to insufficient disc space.

If it happens more often, please try to repair the deck.

Nevertheless, it could be an AnkiDroid bug as well; please report the error that we can check this.
